item.title: Ultralong-Range Electric Cars Are Arriving. Say Goodbye to Charging Stops.
item.description: Ultralong-Range EVs: The Future of Electric Transportation A new class of electric vehicles (EVs) with ultralong range are arriving, making it possible to drive 1,000 miles or more without stopping to charge. These EVs are powered by new battery technology that is more efficient and can store more energy.

item.title: Stellantis Says No Deal Yet in Canada Battery Plant Subsidy Feud
item.description: Stellantis Puts Canadian EV Battery Plant on Hold Stellantis, the parent company of Chrysler, Dodge, and Jeep, has put a hold on construction of an electric-vehicle battery plant in Windsor, Ontario. The company is seeking government subsidies to help fund the $5 billion project, but the Canadian government has not yet committed to any funding.
